Group of Animals: hive, swarm (in flight), bike, drift, grist
dissimulation (small birds only), fleet, flight, flock, parcel, pod, volery
swarm, rabble (group of caterpillars is an army)
clutter, clowder, litter (young born to one female), kindle (kittens)
flock, brood (of hens), clutch (of chicks), peep (of chicks)
litter (pups from one mother), pack (wild), kennel
badelynge, brace, bunch, flock, paddling, raft, team
flock, gaggle, skein (only while in flight), wedge (flying in a "V" formation)
drove, herd, litter (a group of young born to one mother)
stable, harras, herd, team (working horses), string or field (race horses)
clan (related), crowd, family (closely related), community, gang, mob, tribe, etc.
leap, prowl (some say it should be a spot of leopards)
tiding, tribe, charm, gulp, flock, murder
colony, drove, leash, nest, trace, warren
drift, drove, flock, herd, mob, trip

Baby: Snakelet, neonate (a newly-born snake), hatchling (a newly-hatched snake)

Group of Animals: bevy, game, herd, team, wedge (flying in a "V" formation)
